intro: Galium miltorrhizum, commonly known as Chinese knotweed, is a perennial herb native to Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pink flowers and has distinctive, knotted root structures. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Galium miltorrhizum is valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
